name: Alien Shooter 2 Conscription
description: The Great War has begun! The world population capable of functioning is mobilized to serve in the army and the outcome depends on you!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows 2000 / XP / Vista                 Processor: 1.7 GHz                 Memory: 512 MB RAM                 Hard Disk Space: 600 MB                                 Video Card: nVidia GeForce2 / ATI Radeon 8500 or better video card with 64MB video memory                 DirectX®: 8.1                 Sound: DirectSound compatible sound card

reviews.review_text: Fun little isometric shooter. 2h play time. Runs like ♥♥♥♥ sometimes. Good for a coin.
Cool and short game,but very unrealstic,as far as I know there is no possibility to carry that much ammo but that is common for this type of games *sigh*

Yet another Alien Shooter. This time it's conscription. Oh well, like in other Alien Shooters, you shoot aliens. Anyways, if you like to shoot aliens up in a tad old-school style, this is for you. Don't expect many hours out of it though. There are tad kewl mechanics, kewl weapons (can't afford the best ones that easily), many aliens, tasks you don't pay much attention to, stupid lines said by the zeroes and ones you're playing as, and many aliens.  All in all, this game isn't a 'must' in any possible way, but if you like these kind of games, you can give it a shot!  Lil' Sucky Gameplay to go with the review.         YouTube™ Video:  Alien Shooter 2 Conscription Sucky Gameplay
I had fun until I had to protect an NPC. Screw that, just let me mow down aliens!

...with dialogue written in broken english, a main character who looks like he's either constantly river-dancing or moonwalking, a screen resolution so far removed from HD it might as well be on another planet, AND, shockingly but performance issues (never mind the cr@p graphics / sound / etc) - this is one god-awful excuse of a game... AVOID!
